CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, January 17, 1948, pg. 20, reads: "PICKED BY DEMOCRATS - City Magistrate Robert E. (Pappy) Williams, left, was elected Democratic chairman of the Fifth Ward by a unanimous vote in Pittsburgh, Pa. last week. A city official congratulates him as Mrs. Williams looks on.  Mrs. Williams, also a constable, is Pittsburgh's fist Negro magistrate. - Harris Photo."Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 11, 1964, pg. 3, reads: "CONGRATS - Among many persons who in 1948 congratulated Mr. Williams after he was elected first Negro Democratic ward chairman was the unidentified politician shown offering his congratulations as Mrs. Williams observes. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Three men, including Robert E. "Pappy" Williams on left shaking hands with another man, and possibly Matthew Anderson on left, and two women, including Alberta Williams in center wearing fur coat and hat with feathers, posed behind table and in front of stage with dark curtain, after William's election to Democratic Chairman of Fifth Ward
